options.label: C

options.text: Because of the lack of pathos.

options.label: B

options.label: B
options.text: The importance of ethos and pathos.

options.label: A

title: You are your microbes - Jessica Green and Karen Guillemin

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary role of cellulolytic bacteria in the gut?

options.label: C
options.text: To break down cellulose into sugars

multiple-choice.question: Which type of microbes snatches up simple sugars and burns them as fuel?
What is the primary function of fermentors in the gut?

options.label: C
options.text: To convert sugars into chemicals like alcohol and hydrogen gas

multiple-choice.question: What determines the membership of our gut microbial community?

options.label: C
options.text: Genetic makeup, diet, and exposure to different microorganisms

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of having a gut microbial community with only a few different types of workers?
What is one way to revitalize the microbial ecosystem in the gut and across the body?

options.label: A
options.text: Eating a varied diet of complex, plant-based foods

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between gut microbes and the human body?

options.label: A
options.text: Gut microbes are harmful to the human body

options.label: B
options.text: Gut microbes are neutral to the human body

options.label: C
options.text: Gut microbes are essential for the human body

options.label: D
options.text: Gut microbes are optional for the human body

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of having a diverse gut microbial community?
What is one factor that influences the diversity of microbes in the gut?
What is the primary function of syntrophs in the gut?

options.label: C
options.text: To eke out a living off the fermenters' trash
